RECORDS.subject: PALETTE ALERTS: WARN Safety Backup Before Restore Completed, But Copy Failed (%(eventid)s)

This means your Restore request has not been initiated by Palette. We recommend that you check your storage settings here and attempt the request again. Full context is provided below for your reference. If this problem persists, please contact Palette Support at hello@palette-software.com. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} % if info is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info} % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif

PALETTE ALERTS: WARN Palette Server Now Synced with Your Degraded Tableau Primary (%(eventid)s)
RECORDS.event_description: SUMMARY Your Palette Server has synced with your Tableau Primary, however we find that your Tableau Primary machine is degraded. Sometimes a Tableau Process will stop running momentarily to restart itself, which can cause this alert to be triggered. Normally, the Tableau Server Application will recover in less than 5 minutes. If it doesn't, the output below may describe which Tableau Process is stopped. The affected output will also appear yellow or red in the "My Machines" section of the "Status" area in the upper left corner of your Palette browser interface. Full context is provided below for your reference. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} % if tableau_server_url is not UNDEFINED: Tableau Server Application URL: ${tableau_server_url} % else: Tableau Server Application URL: URL is not currently set. % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info} % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif

PALETTE ALERTS: INFO Tableau Server Application Recovered After Partial Process Failure (%(eventid)s)
RECORDS.event_description: SUMMARY Your Tableau Server Application has recovered from a Degrade Event (also called a Tableau Server Status Degrade). If this recovery happens automatically within 5 minutes of the initial Partial Process Degrade Event, then no further action is needed at this time. This is how the Tableau Server was designed to automatically manage its Processes. Full context is provided below for your reference. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} % if tableau_server_url is not UNDEFINED: Tableau Server Application URL: ${tableau_server_url} % else: Tableau Server Application URL: URL is not currently set. % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED or error is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info} % endif % if error is not UNDEFINED: ${error} % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif

RECORDS.subject: PALETTE ALERTS: INFO Tableau Server Application OK Again After Unplanned Stop (%(eventid)s)
RECORDS.event_description: SUMMARY Your Tableau Server Application has returned to normal operation after an unexpected stop. This can sometimes happen if another user has used the Application itself to execute the stop or start. Full context is provided below for your reference. It is recommended that you always use your Palette Server to stop and start your Tableau Server Application to reduce unnecessary false alerts and maintain a record of which users were responsible for stopping/starting the Application. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} % if tableau_server_url is not UNDEFINED: Tableau Server Application URL: ${tableau_server_url} % else: Tableau Server Application URL: URL is not currently set. % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED or error is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info} % endif % if error is not UNDEFINED: ${error} % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif

It is recommended that you always use your Palette Server to stop and start your Tableau Server Application to reduce unnecessary false alerts and maintain a record of which users were responsible for stopping/starting the Application. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} % if tableau_server_url is not UNDEFINED: Tableau Server Application URL: ${tableau_server_url} % else: Tableau Server Application URL: URL is not currently set. % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED or error is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info} % endif % if error is not UNDEFINED: ${error} % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif

RECORDS.subject: PALETTE ALERTS: ERROR CPU Error Threshold on Machine '%(displayname)s' (%(eventid)s)
RECORDS.event_description: SUMMARY The CPU utilization on ${displayname} has exceeded ${cpu_load_error}% for more than ${cpu_period_error} seconds. As a result, your users may be experiencing significantly lower page load times or possibly even page load failures. Full context is provided below for your reference. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} Machine Name: ${displayname} Machine IP: ${ip_address} Machine Hostname: ${fqdn} % if info is not UNDEFINED or error is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info}% % endif % if error is not UNDEFINED: ${error}% % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif WHY THIS EVENT OCCURRED Your CPU Error Alarm is set to trigger when CPU utilization exceeds ${cpu_load_error}% for more than ${cpu_period_error} seconds. You can adjust this value by going to your Configuration Page at ${server_url}/configure/general#monitoring

RECORDS.subject: PALETTE ALERTS: WARN CPU Warning Threshold on Machine '%(displayname)s' (%(eventid)s)
RECORDS.event_description: SUMMARY The CPU utilization on ${displayname} has exceeded ${cpu_load_warn}% for more than ${cpu_period_warn} seconds. As a result, your users may be experiencing slightly lower page load times. Full context is provided below for your reference. DETAILS Event Type: ${event_type_label} Environment: ${environment} Machine Name: ${displayname} Machine IP: ${ip_address} Machine Hostname: ${fqdn} % if info is not UNDEFINED or stdout is not UNDEFINED or stderr is not UNDEFINED: System Message: % endif % if info is not UNDEFINED: ${info}% % endif % if error is not UNDEFINED: ${error}% % endif % if stderr is not UNDEFINED: ${stderr} % endif % if stdout is not UNDEFINED: ${stdout} % endif WHY THIS EVENT OCCURRED Your CPU Warning Alarm is set to trigger when CPU utilization exceeds ${cpu_load_warn}% without exceeding ${cpu_load_error}% for more than ${cpu_period_warn} seconds. You can adjust this value by going to your Configuration Page at ${server_url}/configure/general#monitoring

RECORDS.subject: PALETTE ALERTS: INFO CPU Load Now OK on Machine '%(displayname)s' (%(eventid)s)
